text: The software architecture is modular in order to allow automated testing.
The software architecture is modular in order to allow automated builds.
Tests run automatically, periodically, in a test environment.
When code is integrated, tests run automatically in a test environment.
Tests run automatically, periodically, in a test environment, to verify code coverage.
Builds are canceled if one or more tests fail.
Requirements validation is performed by the (multidisciplinary) development team.
Requirements verification is performed by the (multidisciplinary) development team.
Code is integrated constantly and automatically.
Version control of software artifacts (e.g., code, test, scripts, etc.) is performed in a repository.
Check-in good practices are applied in the development trunk (e.g., use of tools such as GitFlow and Toogle Feature).
The organization adopts practices that allow external organizations to act in the development of the project.
The organization uses metrics that allow the evaluation and data collection for the continuous integration process.
Data produced in continuous integration environments is stored in one (or more) data repository.
The continuous integration process is evaluated and improved continuously.
Data stored in the data repository is used to improve the product and the continuous integration process.
The organization adopts practices for sharing knowledge related to continuous integration (e.g., internal lectures, tutorials, knowledge repositories, guild implementations).
